definition[0]: when a dog barks, it makes a short loud sound or series of sounds
example[0]: The dog always barks at strangers.
definition[1]: to say something quickly in a loud voice
example[1]: ‘Don’t just stand there, give me a hand, ’ she barked at the shop assistant.
definition[2]: to rub the skin off your knee, elbow etc by falling or knocking against something
example[2]: I barked my shin against the step.
definition[3]: the sharp loud sound made by a dog
definition[4]: the outer covering of a tree
example[3]: Amy’s voice was a hoarse bark.
